author: qu0b
content: I'm running into an issue with teku-geth where teku is trying to call engine_newPlayoadV3 before the cancun fork

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yeah sorry about that, the behavior for devnet-7 was to allow this, but I modified it now (in anticipation of devnet-8)

author: stefanbratanov
content: Yeah, previously we were using engine_exchangeCapabilities to determine latest version to use, but from `23.6.2` and `master` we call the appropriate version dependent on the slot. (devnet8 compliant)

author: qu0b
content: I've tried 23.6.2 and that did not work for me

author: stefanbratanov
content: I suppose you are testing teku for devnet-7? `23.6.1` is the last tag that supports it, we already have the changes required for devnet-8 on `23.6.2` and on our `master` branch.

author: qu0b
content: No i am not using the devnet-7 configuration. I'm using the testnet-bootstrapper to generate a configuration on the fly.

author: stefanbratanov
content: Got it. In that case as <@360491619402776577> said, geth has been modified , so is not compatible with 23.6.1 and geth doesn't have devnet-8 branch to be compatible with our latest changes I think. Maybe <@199561711278227457> can help how current compatibility can work?

author: parithosh
content:
<@577788234810130432> you'd need to use the commits and images defined here:
https://github.com/ethpandaops/4844-testnet/blob/master/ansible/inventories/devnet-7/group_vars/all/images.yaml

different clients have different approaches to development, so some merge into dev early on and some keep in feature branches until its fully ready. So your best bet it to rely on that `devnet-name/group_vars/all/images.yaml` file to know which branch or commit to target. 

Afaik your testnet-bootstrapper will need to rebuild images from scratch, so you can't reuse the ethpandaops images (they won't have instrumentation available). So you'll most likely need to pin the commit hashes for the git checkout and build from there.

author: qu0b
content: Thanks, I will give that a go üëç

author: parithosh
content: and just so you know these are for devnet-7, i.e just 4844 related features. Devnet-8 images are not ready yet.

author: .maxyo
content: Is there a timeline on when the sepolia public testnet will launch ?

author: barnabasbusa
content: No. We are still in devnets.

author: .maxyo
content: Will devnet 8 be the last devnet?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dannyryan> devnet 8 will be the first full-feature dencun devnet. there is not a commitment to either doing another or not yet
